intro: Melochia lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf melochia, is a tropical shrub native to parts of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are usually green and slightly hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by distinctive, three-lobed, greenish-black berries. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along riverbanks. Botanically, it belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants.
